{{lowercase}} '''aufs''' (AnotherUnionFS) implements a [[union mount]] for [[Linux]] [[file system]]s.
Developed by [[Junjiro Okajima]] in 2006<ref>[http://aufs.sourceforge.net/History History of the Aufs project maintained by Junjiro Okajima]</ref> aufs is a complete rewriting of the earlier [[UnionFS]]. It aimed to improve reliability and performance, but also introduced some new concepts, like writable branch balancing,<ref>[http://aufs.sourceforge.net/ Goals and new features of aufs in the project's homepage]</ref> and other improvements - some of which are now implemented in the UnionFS 2.x branch.
==Use== Several [[Linux distribution]]s have chosen aufs as a replacement for UnionFS, including: * [[Knoppix]] [[live CD]] [[Linux distribution]] - since the end of 2006, "for better stability & performance"<ref>[http://www.knopper.net/knoppix/knoppix51-en.html Knoppix release note] explaining the switch from UnionFS to aufs.</ref> * [[Slax]] (and Linux-Live scripts in general) since version 6<ref>[http://www.linux-live.org/?changes Linux Live scripts] use AUFS for better stability</ref> * [[Xandros]] Linux distribution, available in the ASUS [[Eee PC]] model 901. * [[Arch Linux]] 2009.08-2011.7<ref>http://www.archlinux.org/news/459/</ref><ref>https://bugs.archlinux.org/task/24742</ref> * [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] 10.04 LTS Live CD * [[Debian]] 6.0 Live media * [[Gentoo Linux]] LiveDVD 11.0<ref>http://www.gentoo.org/news/20110308-livedvd.xml</ref> * [[Gentoo Linux]] LiveDVD 11.2<ref>http://www.gentoo.org/news/20110807-livedvd.xml</ref> * [[Salix_OS#LiveCD_Version|Salix Live]] via Linux-Live scripts until version 13.1.1 and via SaLT from version 13.37.
